Set order context
The order context is useful when applying comparators, or building ordered lists of vertices.

Parameters:
[in] oc requested order context (optional, default is Vertex::PTSUM2
Note:
The order context can be changed even for a const reference to a Vertex. This requires two methods, one with a const qualifier.


void setOrderContext (OrderContext oc=PTSUM2)
void setOrderContext (OrderContext oc=PTSUM2) const
Operators on @c Vertex
Comparators are defined in an order context.

Parameters:
[in] vtx reference to non-modifiable Vertex to compare to.
For example, if order context is Vertex::PTSUM2, `vtx0 < vtx1 == true` if `vtx0.ptSum2() < vtx1.ptSum2()`.

Note:
If the order context of this vertex is different from vtx, the order context of vtx is temporarily set to the one of this.

Detailed Description

Container for vertex variables.

This data object holds kinematic and multiplicity information for a given vertex, in addition to the identification (a number). The object features a Vertex::OrderContext state, which allows to compare two objects with respect to kinematic ordering and equality with respect to a client chosen metric. Available choices are of all or charged particles assigned to the vertex, and with the same particle selections.

Member Function Documentation

void Vertex::addParticle ( const fastjet::PseudoJet &  pJet  ) 

Add a particle or jet to the vertex.

Parameters:
[in] pJet reference to non-modifiable fastjet::PseudoJet object
Note:
This method does not actually add a particle to a vertex, as Vertex does not hold references to particles. Rather, particles hold referencest to vertices. Here the various vertex
characteristics are updated according to the ParticleInfo object attached to the fastjet::PseudoJet.
